question: Which two countries became the first in South East Asia, to eliminate measles and rubella diseases?
explanation:
As per the World Health Organisationâ€™s new release, the Maldives and Sri Lanka have become the first two countries in the South East Asian Region, to eliminate both measles and rubella.
The countries have completely eliminated the diseases ahead of the deadline of 2023. WHO declares a country to have eliminated measles and rubella, when there is no evidence of transmission of the disease for over three years.
